Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: at rim, stopt maeander frieze running left between pairs of dilute lines; below, painted decoration consisting of neck and head of goose to right; on right, part of an animal to right; pendant lozenges and roundels as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Painter of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: The mark on the far right corner on the interior surface of the sherd is likely to be accidental and not part of any interior decoration.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 240, no. 205, pl. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0090) (phase 2)
